what else can I say? This game is amazing, just like the first Half-Life (I am also in the middle of Black Mesa, which is amazing as well) You can't go wrong with the Half-Life series...its first person shooter, meets puzzles, meets science fiction, and it can even get pretty creepy at times too so mix in a little horror and suspense, this game has it all...not to mention it will run smoothly for me on much higher settings than most games will. which I am very happy about. (I was running I think 80+ FPS on that dynamic resolution. 5000 something x 3000 something? I dont remember exactly but it ran great.
My favorite video game of all time.  Love it!
it's a amazing game if u have not tried the game you should!
VERY GOOD GAME STILL LOOKS AMAZEING EVEN 16 YEARS LATER I WOUNDER HOW GOOD YOUR PC HAD 2 BE 2 PLAY THIS BACK IN 2004

Welcome! Welcome to City 17! You have chosen, or have been chosen, to relocate to one of our finest remaining urban centers. I thought so much of City 17 that I elected to established my administration here, in the Citadel so thoughtfully provided by our benefactors. I've been proud to call City 17 my home. And so, whether you are here to stay, or passing through on your way to parts unknown - welcome to City 17. It's safer here.
Very nice game. Just learn how to do some tricks, watch things from desinc and you should be good at the game.
es half life 2 , que mas se puede decir

I've never played Half-Life before this weekend and only played Garry's Mod in the past, so I had no idea what I was in for other than a GMod physics engine. This was one of the best playthroughs I've had. It had a story that was easy to get into, fun chapters, and a good amount of character development. Although nowadays games aren't as hard as they used to be, Half-Life 2 actually provided some difficulty at parts which I enjoyed a ton. I'm really excited to start playing Episode One and Two, and hopefully one day play Half Life: Alyx if I ever get the game. I fully recommend you get the valve complete pack during a sale so that you can own every Half-Life game at once(except Alyx because it isn't in the bundle for some reason :/).

After playing this game in full, I have to say it is ABSOLUTELY worth the hype. Probably the best shooter-related game I've played. The mechanics were great, the story was incredible and even frightening at times. Definitely worth playing, despite it being sixteen years old.

A classic game, has not aged one bit.
The Half-Life series has been so influential on my development that my entire online persona is directly tied to it. So yeah, I guess you could say I like this game.
Amazing game. Definitely on my top 3 recommended

Positives:

  Despite the fact that I've never played HL1, HL2 is a game that in which has aged very well, in fact you may just call the game "timeless" as no matter how old you are or this game is, it has a very good sense of replayability. It also has a story that speaks about socio-political things that have happened and are happening in recent times. I've heard that HL1 has a lot more enemies and whatnot but I think the limited amount of enemies and vehicles in HL2 doesn't make it very repetitive; in fact surprisingly it makes the games more fun as you are more used to each vehicle and it doesn't even get repetitive as things are switched up a lot in the game. The props and places in HL2 give the game a wacky charm and make you think about the lives of NPCs who have had, used, lived in, or made them. You might ask questions like; "I wonder about the little girl that had this doll," or "I wonder why the Combine had to abandon this factory," or "I wonder what this railroad was like when it was in operation,". This game is one of the few I've never actually gotten stuck on, it's always clear where you're supposed to go or do. HL2 has a very (if not the best) versatile and active modding community with weird, goofy, and fun addons always waiting for you to try them, go to the moon in a Coke and Mentos rocket, or just be Shrek. Despite all the good things I have just said about HL2, the best thing I can say about the game is that it can run on anything made post-2004. Since this game had a mid-range desktop desktop audience in mind (in 2004), which means it can virtually run on a potato.

 Negatives: 

  The Resistance and Combine cannot dispute over turf worth a crap. This may because the Resistance were relocated to the place where HL2 takes place and the Combine occupies/occupied it but I don't know because I don't know or remember much about the plot in the beginning or before the game. One area may be filled to the brim with Combine soldiers and another area inside or very near combine turf has a Resistance base, if the Combine really did want to stop the Resistance they'd excavate the area and kill any Resistance personnel but I guess they're not very good at their jobs.

very fun and has excellent physics that combine with gameplay, same with the story section's which blend well with the action and my personal favourite level is "we dont go to ravenholm..." as iit has such a disconnect from the story but such a eerie atmosphere along with the eerie setting of passing through a town that has been completely ravaged. you have only one friendly face and you see remnants of what was before all this and it gives you a feel for the most fun weapon in the game to mess around with. i entirely recomend with all my heart.
